text: A US patent was issued for an "Electric Device," invented by David Misell, which used D size batteries laid end to end in a paper tube with a light bulb and a brass reflector at the end. The batteries only lasted long enough for a "flash" of light, hence the name Flashlight.
In response to Columbia's new 33-RPM long playing record, RCA kicked off a platter war introducing the the seven-inch diameter 45 rpm "single" in the U.S.
NASA announced plans to build the C-5, a three-stage rocket launch vehicle. It became better known as the Saturn V, which launched every Apollo Moon mission.
Sony BMG became the last major label to agree to sell DRM-free MP3s.
